In-depth data discovery

D_HCAExplorer.Rmd

Objectives:

  • Use the HCAExplorer package to identify fastq files for primary analysis.

The HCAExplorer package

library(HCAExplorer)
print(citation("HCAExplorer"), style = "text")
## Van Twisk D, Morgan M (2020). _HCAExplorer: Browse the Human Cell Atlas
## data portal_. R package version 1.4.0, <URL:
## https://github.com/Bioconductor/HCABrowser>.

Built on the HCA azul RESTful API.

hca <- HCAExplorer()
hca
## class: HCAExplorer 
## Using azul backend at:
##   https://service.explore.data.humancellatlas.org

Filtering to a specific project

Identify our favorite project and retrieve detailed metadata about it.

title <- "Assessing the relevance of organoids to model inter-individual variation"
hca %>%
    dplyr::filter(projectTitle %in% title) %>%
    results() %>%
    str()
## tibble [1 × 46] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame)
##  $ protocols.libraryConstructionApproach: chr "10X v2 sequencing, NULL"
##  $ protocols.instrumentManufacturerModel: chr "Illumina HiSeq 2500, NULL"

Obtaining a ‘manifest’ of fastq files.

manifest <-
    hca %>%
    dplyr::filter(projectTitle %in% title) %>%
    getManifest(fileFormat = "fastq.gz")
## sleeping 1 seconds
## sleeping 4 seconds
## No encoding supplied: defaulting to UTF-8.
## 
## ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## cols(
##   .default = col_character(),
##   bundle_version = col_datetime(format = ""),
##   file_size = col_double(),
##   file_version = col_datetime(format = ""),
##   cell_suspension.estimated_cell_count = col_double(),
##   sequencing_protocol.paired_end = col_logical(),
##   specimen_from_organism.preservation_storage.preservation_method = col_logical(),
##   organoid.model_organ_part = col_logical()
## )
## ℹ Use `spec()` for the full column specifications.
  • Manifest created by the service.

    select(file_name, file_uuid) %>%
    distinct()

  • File names mapped to file UUIDs.
  • Files can be retrieved by UUID, e.g., using the HCA CLI (command line interface).

Summary

  • HCAExplorer provides more flexible, but also more complicated, ways to explore the data
  • Enables tasks like identifying and downloading all FASTQ files associated with a project.
